014package org.jdbi.v3.core.statement;
015
016import java.lang.reflect.Type;
017import java.sql.Connection;
018import java.sql.PreparedStatement;
019import java.sql.SQLException;
020import java.sql.Statement;
021import java.util.ArrayList;
022import java.util.Arrays;
023import java.util.HashMap;
024import java.util.List;
025import java.util.Map;
026import java.util.NoSuchElementException;
027import java.util.Optional;
028import java.util.function.Consumer;
029import java.util.function.Function;
030import java.util.function.Supplier;
031
032import org.jdbi.v3.core.Handle;
033import org.jdbi.v3.core.argument.Argument;
034import org.jdbi.v3.core.argument.Arguments;
035import org.jdbi.v3.core.argument.NamedArgumentFinder;
036import org.jdbi.v3.core.argument.internal.NamedArgumentFinderFactory;
037import org.jdbi.v3.core.argument.internal.NamedArgumentFinderFactory.PrepareKey;
038import org.jdbi.v3.core.qualifier.QualifiedType;
039import org.jdbi.v3.core.result.BatchResultBearing;
040import org.jdbi.v3.core.result.ResultBearing;
041import org.jdbi.v3.core.result.ResultIterator;
042import org.jdbi.v3.core.result.ResultProducer;
043import org.jdbi.v3.core.result.ResultProducers;
044import org.jdbi.v3.core.result.ResultSetScanner;
045import org.jdbi.v3.core.result.UnableToProduceResultException;
046import org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.internal.PreparedBinding;
047
048import static org.jdbi.v3.core.result.ResultProducers.returningGeneratedKeys;
049
050/**
051 * Represents a prepared batch statement.  Multiple bindings are added to the
052 * compiled statement and then executed in a single operation. This is, generally,
053 * a very efficient way to execute large numbers of the same statement where
054 * the statement only varies by the arguments bound to it.
055 *
056 * The statement starts with an empty binding.  You bind a single batch of parameters
057 * with the usual {@link SqlStatement} binding methods, and then call
058 * {@link PreparedBatch#add()} to add the current binding as a batch and then clear it.
059 *
060 * An entire batch can be bound and added in one go with {@link PreparedBatch#add(Map)}
061 * or {@link PreparedBatch#add(Object...)}.
062 */
063public class PreparedBatch extends SqlStatement<PreparedBatch> implements ResultBearing {
064    private final List<PreparedBinding> bindings = new ArrayList<>();
065    final Map<PrepareKey, Function<String, Optional<Function<Object, Argument>>>> preparedFinders = new HashMap<>();
066
067    public PreparedBatch(Handle handle, CharSequence sql) {
068        super(handle, sql);
069        getContext().setBinding(new PreparedBinding(getContext()));
070    }
071
072    /**
073     * Deprecated delegate - please use {@code CharSequence} signature for future compatibility.
074     */
075    public PreparedBatch(Handle handle, String sql) {
076        super(handle, (CharSequence) sql);
077    }
078
079    @Override
080    PreparedBatch bindNamedArgumentFinder(NamedArgumentFinderFactory factory, String prefix, Object value, Type type, Supplier<NamedArgumentFinder> backupArgumentFinder) {
081        PreparedBinding binding = getBinding();
082        PrepareKey key = factory.keyFor(prefix, value);
083        preparedFinders.computeIfAbsent(key,
084                pk -> factory.prepareFor(getConfig(), this::buildArgument, prefix, value, type));
085        binding.prepareKeys.put(key, value);
086        binding.backupArgumentFinders.add(backupArgumentFinder);
087        return this;
088    }
089
090    @Override
091    protected PreparedBinding getBinding() {
092        return (PreparedBinding) super.getBinding();
093    }
094
095    Function<Object, Argument> buildArgument(QualifiedType<?> type) {
096        return getContext().getConfig(Arguments.class)
097                .prepareFor(type)
098                .orElse(value ->
099                    (pos, st, ctx) ->
100                        ctx.getConfig(Arguments.class)
101                            .findFor(type, value)
102                            .orElseThrow(() -> new UnableToCreateStatementException("no argument factory for type " + type, ctx))
103                            .apply(pos, st, ctx));
104    }
105
106    @Override
107    public <R> R scanResultSet(ResultSetScanner<R> mapper) {
108        return execute(ResultProducers.returningResults()).scanResultSet(mapper);
109    }
110
111    /**
112     * Execute the batch and return the number of rows affected for each batch part.
113     * Note that some database drivers might return special values like {@link Statement#SUCCESS_NO_INFO}
114     * or {@link Statement#EXECUTE_FAILED}.
115     *
116     * @return the number of rows affected per batch part
117     * @see Statement#executeBatch()
118     */
119    public int[] execute() {
120        try {
121            return internalBatchExecute().updateCounts;
122        } finally {
123            getContext().close();
124        }
125    }
126
127    /**
128     * Execute the batch and return the mod counts as in {@code execute}, but as a
129     * Jdbi result iterator instead of an array.
130     * @return the number of rows affected per batch part
131     * @see #execute()
132     * @see Statement#executeBatch()
133     */
134    public ResultIterator<Integer> executeAndGetModCount() {
135        StatementContext ctx = getContext();
136        final int[] modCount = execute();
137        return new ResultIterator<Integer>() {
138            int pos = 0;
139            @Override
140            public boolean hasNext() {
141                return pos < modCount.length;
142            }
143
144            @Override
145            public Integer next() {
146                if (!hasNext()) {
147                    throw new NoSuchElementException();
148                }
149                return modCount[pos++];
150            }
151
152            @Override
153            public StatementContext getContext() {
154                return ctx;
155            }
156
157            @Override
158            public void close() {
159                ctx.close();
160            }
161        };
162    }
163
164    /**
165     * Execute the batch and give access to any generated keys returned by the operation.
166     *
167     * @param columnNames The column names for generated keys.
168     * @return A {@link ResultBearing} object that can be used to access the results of the batch.
169     * @deprecated Use {@link #executePreparedBatch(String...)} which has the same functionality but also returns the per-batch modified row counts.
170     */
171    @Deprecated
172    public ResultBearing executeAndReturnGeneratedKeys(String... columnNames) {
173        return execute(returningGeneratedKeys(columnNames));
174    }
175
176    /**
177     * Execute the batch and give access to any generated keys returned by the operation.
178     *
179     * @param columnNames The column names for generated keys.
180     * @return A {@link BatchResultBearing} object that can be used to access the results of the batch and the per-batch modified row counts.
181     */
182    public BatchResultBearing executePreparedBatch(String... columnNames) {
183        final ExecutedBatchConsumer executedBatchConsumer = new ExecutedBatchConsumer();
184        final ResultBearing resultBearing = execute(returningGeneratedKeys(columnNames), executedBatchConsumer);
185        return new BatchResultBearing(resultBearing, executedBatchConsumer);
186    }
187
188    /**
189     * Executes the batch, returning the result obtained from the given {@link ResultProducer}.
190     *
191     * @param <R> the type of the result
192     * @param producer the result producer.
193     * @return value returned by the result producer.
194     */
195    public <R> R execute(ResultProducer<R> producer) {
196        return execute(producer, x -> {});
197    }
198
199    private <R> R execute(ResultProducer<R> producer, Consumer<ExecutedBatch> batchConsumer) {
200        try {
201            return producer.produce(() -> {
202                ExecutedBatch batch = internalBatchExecute();
203                batchConsumer.accept(batch);
204                return batch.stmt;
205            }, getContext());
206        } catch (SQLException e) {
207            try {
208                close();
209            } catch (Exception e1) {
210                e.addSuppressed(e1);
211            }
212            throw new UnableToProduceResultException("Exception producing batch result", e, getContext());
213        }
214    }
215
216    private ExecutedBatch internalBatchExecute() {
217        if (!getBinding().isEmpty()) {
218            add();
219        }
220
221        beforeTemplating();
222
223        final StatementContext ctx = getContext();
224
225        ParsedSql parsedSql = parseSql();
226        String sql = parsedSql.getSql();
227        ParsedParameters parsedParameters = parsedSql.getParameters();
228
229        try {
230            try {
231                StatementBuilder statementBuilder = getHandle().getStatementBuilder();
232                @SuppressWarnings("PMD.CloseResource")
233                Connection connection = getHandle().getConnection();
234                stmt = statementBuilder.create(connection, sql, ctx);
235
236                addCleanable(() -> statementBuilder.close(connection, sql, stmt));
237                getConfig(SqlStatements.class).customize(stmt);
238            } catch (SQLException e) {
239                throw new UnableToCreateStatementException(e, ctx);
240            }
241
242            if (bindings.isEmpty()) {
243                return new ExecutedBatch(stmt, new int[0]);
244            }
245
246            beforeBinding();
247
248            try {
249                ArgumentBinder binder = new ArgumentBinder.Prepared(this, parsedParameters, bindings.get(0));
250                for (Binding binding : bindings) {
251                    ctx.setBinding(binding);
252                    binder.bind(binding);
253                    stmt.addBatch();
254                }
255            } catch (SQLException e) {
256                throw new UnableToExecuteStatementException("Exception while binding parameters", e, ctx);
257            }
258
259            beforeExecution();
260
261            try {
262                final int[] modifiedRows = SqlLoggerUtil.wrap(stmt::executeBatch, ctx, getConfig(SqlStatements.class).getSqlLogger());
263
264                afterExecution();
265
266                ctx.setBinding(new PreparedBinding(ctx));
267
268                return new ExecutedBatch(stmt, modifiedRows);
269            } catch (SQLException e) {
270                throw new UnableToExecuteStatementException(Batch.mungeBatchException(e), ctx);
271            }
272        } finally {
273            bindings.clear();
274        }
275    }
276
277    /**
278     * Add the current binding as a saved batch and clear the binding.
279     * @return this
280     */
281    public PreparedBatch add() {
282        final PreparedBinding currentBinding = getBinding();
283        if (currentBinding.isEmpty()) {
284            throw new IllegalStateException("Attempt to add() an empty batch, you probably didn't mean to do this "
285                    + "- call add() *after* setting batch parameters");
286        }
287        bindings.add(currentBinding);
288        getContext().setBinding(new PreparedBinding(getContext()));
289        return this;
290    }
291
292    /**
293     * Bind arguments positionally, add the binding as a saved batch, and
294     * then clear the current binding.
295     * @param args the positional arguments to bind
296     * @return this
297     */
298    public PreparedBatch add(Object... args) {
299        for (int i = 0; i < args.length; i++) {
300            bind(i, args[i]);
301        }
302        add();
303        return this;
304    }
305
306    /**
307     * Bind arguments from a Map, add the binding as a saved batch,
308     * then clear the current binding.
309     *
310     * @param args map to bind arguments from for named parameters on the statement
311     * @return this
312     */
313    public PreparedBatch add(Map<String, ?> args) {
314        bindMap(args);
315        add();
316        return this;
317    }
318
319    /**
320     * Returns the number of bindings in this batch.
321     *
322     * @return the number of bindings in this batch.
323     */
324    public int size() {
325        return bindings.size();
326    }
327
328    private static class ExecutedBatch {
329        final PreparedStatement stmt;
330        final int[] updateCounts;
331
332        ExecutedBatch(PreparedStatement stmt, int[] updateCounts) {
333            this.stmt = stmt;
334            this.updateCounts = Arrays.copyOf(updateCounts, updateCounts.length);
335        }
336    }
337
338    private static final class ExecutedBatchConsumer implements Consumer<ExecutedBatch>, Supplier<int[]> {
339
340        private int[] modifiedRowCounts = new int[0];
341
342        @Override
343        public void accept(ExecutedBatch executedBatch) {
344            // has been copied within the executed batch
345            this.modifiedRowCounts = executedBatch.updateCounts;
346        }
347
348        @Override
349        @SuppressWarnings("PMD.MethodReturnsInternalArray")
350        public int[] get() {
351            // Array was copied as when the ExecutedBatch was created, so exposing it is fine.
352            return modifiedRowCounts;
353        }
354    }
355}
